name: Serendipity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit and from the moment we arrived we felt at home. Nothing is too trouble for the thoughtful owners who make you feel so welcome in their wonderful home. Every detail has been thought about in the immaculately clean rooms. An enormous advantage of staying here is that you can enjoy the five star dining without having to drive. We can not wait to return.
reviews.title: Absolute perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not expect to have a meal of this caliber in the little town of Wilderness. It did not start well, as first of all, we got a bit lost trying to find the restaurant and guest house. Then when we entered we were asked by a young man to wait in the lounge. We asked and were then taken to the porch overlooking the estuary where we were given menus. The chef, the wife of the couple that own it, came out and explained the menu to us. You can choose a number of courses and have a few choices within each course. What followed was a beautiful, creative, delicious meal, accompanied by recommended wines that enhanced the flavors. The couple themselves are delightful and friendly. Their beautiful home was converted to this restaurant guest house. Our only regret is that we didn't buy some of the perforated ostrich eggs that held the tea lights on each table. Go and eat there if you ever go to southern South Africa.
reviews.title: A sublime meal

reviews.text: This guesthouse is an amazing place to enjoy nature ( the birds are stunning ! ), peace, wonderful service and attention to detail by the owners.
reviews.title: anytime again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner and breakfast were fab, so was the swim in the river the next morning. It's great to be able to just walk down the patio for a dip in the river. Looking forward to give the canoe (provided by the guesthouse for free ! ) a try next time.
reviews.title: Superb service by Elsabe & Phillip !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommendable ! Don't be shy to ask for advice for hikes or stuff to do, very helpful people there!
reviews.title: Good Accommodation Great Restaurant

reviews.text: If you have not been to South Africa, you should know that guest house standards are generally very high. I am pleased to say that the Serendipity Guest House raises that bar even higher! I have stayed there on several previous occasions and traveled with American friends again in March. Serendipity is centrally located for exploring the Garden Route. I am also comforted knowing several world class golf resorts are nearby. Host's, Elsabe & Phillip Kuypers, are very involved with guests and can always point you in the right direction. A delightful bonus is the five star restaurant , of the same name, located on the ground floor of the Guest House. The award winning chef is none other than the Kuypers daughter, Lizelle, who owns the restaurant with her husband, Rudolph. If your interests lie with deep sea fishing, diving or gourmet dining, you have to stay at Serendity!
reviews.title: South African Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tour of South Africa would not have been fully complete without a 2 night stay at this excellent establishment. It combines good accommodation with excellent food and very friendly service. It is also very well located to allow sightseeing to local places of interest and also for good beaches for swimming (or even just relaxing). Don't overlook the canoe option on the adjoining lake to build up an appetite for dinner!! The pre-dinner reception with the "maitre-de" and the opportunity to chat during the meal with the star chef add to the entire experience. We will return.
reviews.title: Food & Fun

reviews.text: We rocked up into Wilderness with no pre-booked accommodation, but I knew a few B&B names and followed the signs Serendipity due to reviews on TA.
reviews.title: Every Aspect of Our Visit was Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am so glad I did, it was truly wonderful. From the little fountain in front of the house, which the birds use as a bath, to the canoes we were allowed to use, the library, every physical aspect was well designed, thought out, bright and clean. The rooms are fabulously light, airy and have access to a deck to look out over the lagoon. Welcoming drinks are a lovely touch, especially after an hour or two in the car on a hot day.
reviews.title: Serendipity - a little gem in Wilderness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts are just great, such attention to details, home baked scones or pancakes, and all served with a warm smile.
reviews.title: Good venue in Wilderness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been staying at Serendipity for several years and have become good friends with the owners Elsabe and Phillip De Kuypers. Well appointed rooms with nice views of the Lagoon. A very nice breakfast too. You are assured of a nice welcome. the restaurant is something else and Lizelle and Rudolf have set the example for others to follow. The cuisine is superb and the Wine Pairing that is available for the meal is really worth a try. The 5 courses are currently 300+ Rand but like all things "you get what you pay for" and you will not be disappointed. The restaurant is open everyday except Sunday and is available for non-residents.
reviews.title: Great hospitality and a gastronomic delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went there for our 4 years anniversary and we could not have found a better place! The setting is absolutely lovely, close to the river with a patio from the rooms that you can enjoy an early coffee while obersving the birds and listening to this beautiful surrounding Nature. The food was absolutely divine and it is a must to book a dinner at the restaurant!!! Two days was not enough so we'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: Romantic place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed from Monday to Friday and received a very warm welcome followed by attentive, but not overbearing service from everyone. The owners Elsabe and Phillip made our stay especially memorable by sharing their knowledge of the area as well as the property with us. It is worth a visit just to spend some time chatting with Phillip over breakfast about his exploits before Serendipity.
reviews.title: Wonderful week away
Dinner
reviews.text: The restaurant was wonderful and the two evenings we spent in the company of Lizelle and Rudolph were fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities are great, the feeling homely and the hosts wonderful.
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else in Wilderness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our two night stay at Serendipity was fantastic. The room was extremely comfortable with many little touches adding to the enjoyment. The bathroom is small but has a good supply of towels and amenities needed. Once the bedroom widows were closed all road noise was blocked out. Breakfast was delicious and served by Elsabe, who kept us informed of what to do. The guest house is a 20 minute walk from the village, situated in a lovely residential area. The view from the patio and balcony is fantastic. Serendipity Restaurant is 100% excellent - another good feature for the guest house. We will definitely stay here again when next visiting Wilderness.
reviews.title: Amazing value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Phillipp's and Elsebe's B&B before and it is difficult to envision a more blissful stay. Situated at the estuary, you enjoy the quiet surroundings and the bird life. They have canoes, so you can have a lovely time sailing around and watch mother Nature. Their daughter, Lizelle, is a star chef and together with her husband Rudolf, who provides for a cozy and joyous atmosphere in the restaurant, you are taken to culinary heights difficult to find elsewhere. Overall, an absolute worthwhile stay.
reviews.title: Simply blissful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Elizabeth & Kris Kristensen
reviews.title: Serendipity - Hotel or Restaurant?

reviews.text: We stayed for one night in order to experience the wonderful food in the restaurant which was fantastic! The hotel has 4 rooms and has an excellent outlook across the river. The one slight problem was the presence of a little road noise.
reviews.title: Sublime Serendipity...Haste Ye Back!

reviews.text: We all have experiences that meet or exceed our expectations. Like savoring a fine South African wine, traveling in a fine touring sedan or watching the back nine holes of a golf Major.A re-visit to the Serendipity Guest House was just such an experience! I was fortunate to visit for a second time after a March visit a year ago. The view of the lagoon from the upper deck was just as soothing, the birdlife viewed while enjoying morning coffee was prolific and the owners, Phillip & Elsabe Kuypers, were more than gracious! Even my fellow guests shared common interest's, birding, golf and fishing! Maybe the British are right...if you find a place you like, why not return year after year!?! Oh, I should also mention that the on site restaurant of the same name, is just as fabulous! Make sure you make reservations in advance as the limited seating nearly fully booked every night!
reviews.title: A holiday experience

description: Serendipity Wilderness, a 5-Star Restaurant and Guesthouse, is a sprawling multi-storey residence with serene and graceful double volume public areas, with fireplaces, situated in a manicured garden on the banks of the Touw River Lagoon, managed by academic and professionally trained owners. Dining at Serendipity offers superb cuisine, friendly and professional service in a graceful setting. A five course South African inspired menu, experienced in a refined atmosphere, is the benchmark of Serendipity
